But in an opinion released Friday Judge Karen LeCraft Henderson of U.S. Court of Appeals in Washington wrote that the religious freedom act does not apply to the Guantanamo detainees because they are not "persons" for the purposes of U.S law. 
 
 The three-judge panel also held that the U.S. officials were immune from the torture claims because, as held by the trial court: "torture is a foreseeable consequence of the military's detention of suspected enemy combatants." In other words, the court held that the officials that allegedly engaged in torture did so as part of their assigned duties to interrogate.
 

 
 The detainees were supported in their litigation by a wide range of church groups across the religious spectrum, which were concerned about the government using faith-based humiliation as an interrogation tool. 
 
 
Interestingly, Judge Janice Rogers Brown, an evangelical, while concurring in the court's opinion, wrote a separate opinion, criticizing the majority for using a definition of person "at odds with its plain meaning." She wrote, "There is little mystery that a 'person' is an individual human being...as distinguished from an animal or thing." Brown said the opinion "leaves us with the unfortunate and quite dubious distinction of being the only court to declare those held at Guantánamo are not 'person[s].' This is a most regrettable holding in a case where plaintiffs have alleged high-level U.S. government officials treated them as less than human." 
 
 Eric Lewis, the Washington lawyer who argued the case for the detainees, said in a statement Friday, "It is an awful day for the rule of law and common decency when a court finds that torture is all in a days' work for the secretary of defense and senior generals."

 
 So now not only are we arresting and detaining people indefinatly without any recourse, we have gone one step further and we are jsut going to say they are not even people. They are subhuman.

You would think that the fact we made it through 2 world wars and multiple smaller conflicts later without adopting such a stance would have some bearing on what would be "forseeable".

 2 years of silly war around those silly cartoons that are ridiculing Muhammad Islam zealots say. Why on earth those stubborn Danes took into their heads to make new reprinting of that sticking point between Muslims and other Europeans? I don't think that Danes are so stupid that they would commit such dangerous provocation. Many say that this is Albanian separatists' handwork. And those rumours about preparing assassination of cartoonist are spread by US special service. That's some kind of black mail and demonstration to Europeans what furious Islam zealots are capable of. I regard that some indirect claim of acknowledging independent Kosovo by all Europeans. I'm afraid that such disturbances on strained pretexts would sweep across entire Europe.
 And here's the problem. For in fact those Albanians presented us ultimatum. They think that they can intimidate us and impose us their will. What their behavior would be when they'll gain their beloved independence? That would be a bomb. Albanian Kosovo is death for Christian Europe
 
 Notice that according to her it is 'stupid Danes' who commit 'dangerous provocation' so it's their fault that Islamic Fanatics are out wreaking havoc. Of course, it is the US special service and Albanian separatists' to blame as well causing the zealots, who can't help themselves, to go nuts. The lunacy is sickening.

Things are changing from bad to worse in this country. I wonder why the theft of confidential data from state institutions has become the habitual practice just? I hope you are in the know about the present police probe into the theft of a confidential Home Office computer disk. Those thefts of sensitive data seem to be endless! Surely the disk was encrypted. But my buddy (who's actually a computer wizard) asserts that disks with even sophisticated level of encryption are accessible sooner or later. Can you be sure the data hasn't ended up in the wrong hands? Me not. 
 Now ... in Britain you can't be sure of anything actually, personal safety including. Our govt headed by that looser G. Brown is gust gathering of corrupted beasts making hot money even by trading titles. Most irritating is that our precious secret services are staying idle amid that mess. They seem to be more and more involved in political matters than doing their original job and that is defending us, me and you. And our primer is busy trying to please America. That's all.
 IMHO we need a new primer and a new govt and a new MI-5 and whatever to feel safe and sound in the UK! Otherwise we'll see the same vicious circle and .... expect more bad news then.
